title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.4
body:
new "Minions" art created by inkinesss!

Hey guys! Welcome to Patch Chat, a Dev Corner thread we make to talk about our new patches every two weeks: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-74-notes

I'm Aesah on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of Diamond+ players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to LoL in terms of both balance and fun. We'll be watching this thread to answer as many questions as we can.

7.4 comes with a variety of changes. On the armor penetration front, Black Cleaver has been too consistently powerful as an offensive first item, so some of the power is being shifted into defensive stats. Last Whisper will a lot more effective in it's tank-busting role as a base item without the upgrades. Lethality seems decent right now, so Ghostblade is getting a nerf (Lethality is likely to be looked at more in the near future). For masteries, damage is going down across the board. In the bot lane, we're making Fervor a more attractive option relative to Warlord's Bloodlust which should lead to more exciting high moments rather than farmfests. Champions with notable changes include a big change to Cho'gath's ultimate to encourage tank builds, nerfs to overperforming champions (Maokai, Jhin, Ryze, and Corki), and a roaming buff for Bard. 

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

Adam "Afic" Cohen
Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt

Did any of you actually test how the sweeper change is destroying Shaco's start?

A lone support can now clear my whole starting camp of boxes from over a wall... before recalling with enough time to switch to yellow trinket and get to his jungle in time to leash.
That support is really out of position then, and could likely get caught out if your team is standing by.

Right but they won't be alone.

Due to some oddness with how the boxes stack and how far Shaco can place a box over a wall, Shaco will have to be in the redbuff pit.

Meaning that if the enemy team invades it is 3v4... before allies could fall back to the second bush and together stack and cover there...

If your team didn't stack there the enemy still had to walk into the boxes and trigger them taking a risk...

However now the enemy doesn't have to face check that second bush at all... the support just walks up next to redbuff wall and sweepers over the wall clearing all of your boxes and then they back out...

Support recalls and switches to yellow trinket and is back in time to leash for the jungler. The yellow trinket will be on cd for roughly a minute of time that it matters... but Shaco will be delayed by roughly 15 seconds, a smite, and at least 1 health pot.

In diamond where timing is everything it screws you over for a solid 5 minutes or so... all of your ganks and counter gank options are off their normal timings and it takes away most of your pressure.
Honestly -- shaco is powerful enough to take this hit without any issues.

Hey Goku!

There aren't any immediate plans to buff Taliyah.  While her overall win rate is low, it is difficult to justify buffing her because she has a high win rate for experienced players and she continues to see occasional pro play (mainly in LCK and EULCS).

As understandable as that is, it's still frustrating for people like me, who are either unranked or in bronze, to play Taliyah. I was trying to get an S on Taliyah for rank 6 and ended up just playing tali games over and over for three months because I couldn't match how the pros were playing. Its also frustrating when Kassadin just ults through your E with no dmg taken and Yasuo wind walls your ulti and cancels it. Lets just say Taliyahs on the bench for now.

i think one of the most rewarding feelings in this game is the experience of learning to play a high skillcap champion really well. I really enjoy playing Yasuo, Velkoz, Draven, Taliyah because they're so complex. I know that I might win more often if I decided to play more simple champions (exception of Vel- i think he's overpowered), but it's that long period of failing over and over learning Yasuo that makes executing a skilled play so exhilarating. If you really want to enjoy playing Taliyah, don't be discouraged by her difficulty. It doesn't matter what level you play at- you will get better at a champion by playing it more. You won't get better at a champion by waiting for buffs. League may be competitive, but in the end it's a game. Have fun. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Hey Monado!

I'm one of the support players (TheLastAirbender) on the playtest team.

It really helps your roaming potential; you can use the chimes to reach your destination even faster now and roam around the map a bit better than before, depending on chimes. We expect the more experienced Bard players to be able to utilize this to its fullest potential since they already have a good feel on when to roam on bard and how to take the fullest advantage of the chimes to roam successfully. It is not a large change but we definitely feel that this change can help in these scenarios :) 

Keep chimin' on my dude and give your midlaners some love ;)

Hello Playtest Team!

In regard to the Jhin nerf, what was the reasoning behind cutting power off of his long range map presence? 

In the past, Riot has been clear that they tend to focus on honing a champion's strengths and unique attributes and cutting power from unclear or non-defining parts of a champion's kit. I would have expected that for Jhin, the marksman defined by his long range presence (ult damage, slow, snare) with a clear weakness in lacking up-close DPS (reload mechanic), that power would have been taken from his still somewhat high short range DPS rather than his long range presence. Thanks for your time, guys!

I would have expected that for Jhin, the marksman defined by his long range presence (ult damage, slow, snare) with a clear weakness in lacking up-close DPS (reload mechanic), that power would have been taken from his still somewhat high short range DPS rather than his long range presence. Thanks for your time, guys!

Hey OTK,

I definitely agree with you that Jhin is very defined by his long range capabilties and it may feel like we are reducing some of his cool long range presence. Sure, this does not make him as powerful as he is now in terms of long range presence but this nerf felt needed due to the fact that if he hits his first shot he basically lines up the massively damaging shots afterwards without too much effort. This is extremely rough for squishies that get caught by the first shot and basically get 100-0'd in late game by Jhin's ultimate. So, giving people a slightly larger window (.25 seconds, .75 -> .5 seconds)  to move freely to try to perhaps dodge or juke Jhin's shots helps. 

Thanks for your comment! Hope this helps explain some of it.
